newsitem.title: USA: Arafat, Clinton hold private Mideast crisis talk.
newsitem.headline: Arafat, Clinton hold private Mideast crisis talk.

text.p: U.S. President Bill Clinton and Palestinian President Yasser Arafat met at the White House on Tuesday as part of a U.S.-hosted Middle East crisis summit.

Arafat's private discussion with Clinton followed a similar meeting between the president and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, which opened Clinton's planned two-day effort to prevent a collapse of Middle East peace negotiations.
Jordan's King Hussein, who had a pre-summit meeting with Clinton on Monday night, was also taking part and was to join the other three at a group meeting planned for Tuesday afternoon.
The summit was prompted by an eruption of violence last week in the Gaza Strip and West Bank that has threatened to destroy ongoing Isaeli-Palestinian peace negotiations.
